an4.124:4.1: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
an4.124:4.3: Firstly, a person, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption …
an4.124:4.4: They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.
an4.124:4.5: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the pure abodes.
an4.124:4.6: This rebirth is not shared with ordinary people.
an4.124:5.1: As the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, they enter and remain in the second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption …
an4.124:5.2: They contemplate the phenomena there—included in form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness—as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.
an4.124:5.3: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of the pure abodes.
an4.124:5.4: This rebirth is not shared with ordinary people.
an4.124:5.5: These are the four people found in the world.”
